ygData.subject: Re: Banded Prices
ygData.msgSnippet: depends how much you value your work and time. I can make more money potting than smithing, so I sell tunics for 20pp. Makes it worth my while to stop spinning
ygData.messageBody:
depends how much you value your work and time. I can make more money potting than smithing,
so I sell tunics for 20pp. Makes it worth my while to stop spinning the wheel and pick up
the hammer instead. Otherwise, I'm outta smithing, it doesn't have anything for me :)
-Rennin of E'Ci
Trade Council GM

Jason Coan wrote:

> From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
>
> concidering you have about a 15pp profit if selling at 20pp, 15pp profit is a bit steep.
>
> >>> "Chris Lin" <chrislin@...> 7.14.99 12:35:09 PM >>>
> From: "Chris Lin" <chrislin@...>
>
> Anything above 20 plat is a ripoff? I wouldn't say it's a ripoff, but given
> the current market status, it is high. The only ripoff would be if we were
> selling much higher than chain prices, which we never will. 20pp for a
> tunic is prefectly resonable.
>
> Trenfen of Fennin Ro
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: Jason Coan <COANJ@...>
> To: <EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com>
> Sent: Wednesday, July 14, 1999 10:50 AM
> Subject: Re: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Banded Prices
>
> > From: "Jason Coan" <COANJ@...>
> >
> > ore...free
> > mold...few gold
> > water...few silver
> >
> > cost of materials is only a couple of plat, so for someone to sell a few
> gold above cost, the tunic would have to be no more than about 5
> plat....i've never seen anybody selling that cheap. 10plat a tunic is still
> a big profit, 20plat a tunic is a huge profit, anything above 20plat is a
> rip off.
> >
> > > As for the fixed prices, I'm all for it. I haven't reached the level
> where
> > > I can make banded yet, but when I get there, I want more than a few gold
> > > profit for my wares. I do have a further suggestion though. When you
> see
> > > people selling at a few gold above cost, bargain with them to get their
> >
